title: Fixing the intent-filter in the manifest
message:
Fixing the intent-filter in the manifest

This fix makes it possible to open zmachine files even if the
mimeType was not set to x-zmachine.

Note that in such cases, the browser will download the file first,
and then the user will have to click on the download to launch Twisty.

title: Fixing bug caused by replacing the intent-filter.
message:
Fixing bug caused by replacing the intent-filter.

Losing the original intent-filter meant that Twisty is no longer able
to be launched from the applications menu.

title: Try to work around a cupcake bug whereby the soft-keyboard
message:
Try to work around a cupcake bug whereby the soft-keyboard
"Enter" key doesn't generate an onKey event.

This workaround was recommended by another android hacker:

- Create a view that overrides the onCreateInputConnection() method.
- Return a new InputConnection that overrides the PerformEditorAction
function.
- The PerformEditorAction function will be called when the enter key is
pressed.

...however, I think I've done this, and while the log shows
keycodes for non-Enter keys, it appears that performEditorAction()
still isn't being called at all, even on Enter.  Am I missing something?

title: Implement simple loading of .z games from sdcard.
message:
Implement simple loading of .z games from sdcard.

We follow the "proper" android pattern of scanning the sdcard for all
*.z[1-8] files, then showing a simple dialog for choosing one.

Unfortunately, this means deprecating (and removing) Marius' brilliant
FileBrowser activity.  As nice as it is, it's "un-androidey" to expose
sdcard paths to users.  If we ever need it again, it's in svn history.

Possible future usability enhancements:

  - have a service (daemon) that scans sdcard at card insert time?
    or on some other sdcard-writing event?
  - if we scan at dialog-invocation time, we might want to put up
    a progress dialog revealing the scan.

title: Try making ZState invoke a dialog box which would
message:
Try making ZState invoke a dialog box which would
eventually prompt the user for a filename.

This code DOES NOT WORK, however:  the AlertDialog fails
at runtime, screaming about launching out of a thread which
hasn't properly prepared Looper.prepare() android Handler blah blah.

This makes sense, I guess -- since the main Activity spawns
the ZMachine in its own Thread.  Somehow we need to move this code
back to the main Twisty thread, and have the ZMachine thread 'signal'
the original thread.  (Another option, I guess, is to make
the whole savefile-prompt into a completely new Activity?)

title: Make orientation-changing NOT restart the activity:  thanks to Adam Bliss.
message: Make orientation-changing NOT restart the activity:  thanks to Adam Bliss.

title: Try to implement onPause() and onResume() by serializing
message:
Try to implement onPause() and onResume() by serializing
the whole ZMachine to a private file.  This fails, however,
since not every included class is serializable.  (We can't
make android.graphics.Bitmap implement Serializable, for example!)

Checkpointing my work in svn anyway.  We'll have to find a
different strategy instead.  Perhaps we just serialize ZState alone,
and then have onResume() create a whole new ZMachine from the zmemimage,
and restore the execution state into it.
